articles.title: Pound slumps against euro as ECB plots more interest rate rises - live updates - The Telegraph
articles.description: The pound has dropped to its weakest against the euro since early 2021 as traders gear up for more interest rate rises by the European Central Bank.
articles.content:
Good morning.
We begin the week with more gloomy economic data as Britain edges further towards recession.
GDP expanded just 0.2pc in July after slumping 0.6pc in June due to the Platinum Jubilee b… [+1774 chars]

articles.title: Brexit: EU's Sefcovic offers to reduce NI border controls to 'couple of lorries a day' - The Independent
articles.description: GB-NI trade border can be almost ‘invisible’, says European Commission VP in bid to restart talks
articles.content: The EUs Brexit chief Maros Sefcovic has said he wants to reduce physical customs checks across the Irish Sea to just a few lorries a day in a bid to break the impasse over the Northern Ireland Protoc… [+3650 chars]

articles.title: ESA - Solar Orbiter solves magnetic switchback mystery - European Space Agency
articles.description: With data from its closest pass of the Sun yet, the ESA/NASA Solar Orbiter spacecraft has found compelling clues as to the origin of magnetic switchbacks, and points towards how their physical formation mechanism might help accelerate the solar wind.
articles.content:
Science & Exploration12/09/2022326 views8 likes
With data from its closest pass of the Sun yet, the ESA/NASA Solar Orbiter spacecraft has found compelling clues as to the origin of magnetic swit… [+7612 chars]

articles.title: Oil prices could spike in winter, Yellen says - Reuters
articles.description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen on Sunday said Americans could experience a spike in gas prices in the winter when the European Union significantly cuts back on buying Russian oil, adding that a proposed Western price cap on Russia's oil exports is being…
